clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Sonographically Guided Subacromial Bursa Injection With Hyperosmolar Dextrose in Chronic Subacromial Bursitis
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Sonographically Guided Subacromial Bursa Injection With Hyperosmolar Dextrose in Chronic Subacromial Bursitis

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to compare treatment efficacy of different concentration dextrose injection in chronic subacromial bursitis .

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline visual analog scale (VAS) at 1 month after 3rd section of therapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: before therapy sections and 1 month after third section of therapy
primary_outcome.description: maximal VAS in the past week during movement, maximal VAS in the past week during resting, VAS during passive range of motion (PROM) in abduction & flexion and during empty can test

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline VAS at 3 months after 3rd section of therapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: before therapy sections and 3 months after third section of therapy
primary_outcome.description: maximal VAS in the past week during movement, maximal VAS in the past week during resting, VAS during passive range of motion (PROM) in abduction & flexion and during empty can test

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline VAS at moment after 3rd section of therapy

primary_outcome.description: maximal VAS in the past week during movement, maximal VAS in the past week during resting, VAS during passive range of motion (PROM) in abduction & flexion and during empty can test

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. 20-65 years-old
2. pain lasting >3 months
3. Painful arc between 40° to 120° in abduction
4. positive Neer and Hawkins-Kennedy tests
5. positive Empty can test
6. pain in daily living activities
7. Bursa thickness more than 2mm in ultrasound
Exclusion Criteria:
1. history of significant shoulder trauma
2. history of surgery, fracture, or dislocation
3. adhesive capsulitis
4. full thickness rotator cuff tear
5. a long head of bicep tendon tear
6. Contra-indications to local dextrose injection (known blood coagulation disorders, warfarin therapy, allergy to dextrose)
7. previous shoulder steroid injection in one month
8. had any rheumatologic, systemic, or neurologic disorders
9. patients taking regular systemic NSAIDs or steroids
10. pregnant or breastfeeding mothers
11. malignancy
